intro: Erythrodes crispifolius, commonly known as the red-fruited crinkled-leaf plant, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive red, fleshy fruits and crinkled, often hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a serrated margin, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. Erythrodes crispifolius is often found in forest understories and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
